intro: Rosa gallica f. columnifera, commonly known as the upright form of the Gallic rose, is a compact, shrub-like plant with dense, upright growth. It features small, fragrant flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has dark green, glossy leaves that are arranged in an alternating pattern along its stems. It is native to Europe and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a heritage plant in botanical collections.
